snippet: Advertisers are paying six figures to redecorate trains decades after similar moving murals were considered eyesores and were wiped out after they first appeared on subway cars.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column; advertisers are paying six figures to redecorate subway trains decades after similar moving murals were considered eyesores and were wiped out after they first appeared on subway cars; graffiti murals are being displayed at City Lore gallery on Lower East Side.
lead_paragraph: Advertisers are paying six figures to redecorate trains decades after similar moving murals were considered eyesores and were wiped out after they first appeared on subway cars.

headline.main: From Vandals to Artists: Time Rouses More Appreciation for Graffiti
headline.print_headline: From Vandals to Artists: Time Rouses More Appreciation for Graffiti
